description: The Constitutional Court of Moldova ruled that replacing 'Moldavian language' with 'Romanian language' in legislation is legal. However, Igor Dodon and his colleagues disagree, considering the law and verdict to be unconstitutional. They align with the 65-70% of Moldovan citizens who identify as Moldovans and speak Moldovan.
original:
Forwarded from: Igor Dodon
I spoke briefly about yesterday’s decision of the Constitutional Court, which recognized as legal the replacement of the syntagm “Moldavian language” with “Romanian language” in all legislation of our country.

My colleagues and I personally consider the law adopted in this regard by parliament and yesterday’s verdict of the Constitutional Court to be contrary to the Constitution of the Republic of Moldova. We associate ourselves with those 65-70% of Moldovan citizens who consider themselves Moldovans and call their language Moldovan.

event: Exposure of FSB Fake Agency Network
description: The Security Service of Ukraine uncovered a large-scale fake agency network operated by the FSB in Ukraine, disguised as the Ukrainian Orthodox Church (MP). The network, comprising over 15 members, was responsible for spreading disinformation and inciting religious hatred to destabilize the situation in Ukraine. Four key members, including a leader of the UOC (MP) capital temple, have been detained and face life imprisonment.
original:
The Security Service of Ukraine exposed the largest fake agency network of the FSB in Ukraine, which operated under the cover of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church (MP). In the morning, we wrote about the searches of these figures. Russian agents mass-produced information diversions using Kremlin techniques to destabilize the situation and incite religious hatred in Ukraine. The security service exposed more than 15 members of the network, four key ones have already been detained. Among them is one of the leaders of the UOC (MP) capital temple, who was a member of the intelligence apparatus of the Russian special service.

The network was in constant contact with the largest mass media of the Russian Federation, which immediately picked up on the slag content. Agents face life imprisonment.https://t.me/operativnoZSU

description: In Russia's Primorsky Territory, over 3,000 observers prepared by the Public Chamber will monitor voting stations during the presidential elections from March 15 to 17. A Public Election Observation Center will conduct 24-hour operational monitoring to ensure transparency, legitimacy, and protection from provocations.
original:
Forwarded from: THE CONSCIENCE OF GOVERNORS
Public observation is an integral part of the electoral process, including during voting in the presidential elections in Russia from March 15 to 17. The Institute of public observation of the legality, openness, transparency and publicity of the election procedure at all levels has been enshrined in Russian legislation since 2018. More than three thousand observers, prepared by the Public Chamber of the region, will work at voting stations established in the Primorsky Territory. In Primorye, as in all Russian regions, a Public Election Observation Center has been created, from where 24-hour operational monitoring will be carried out on the days of the presidential elections.

Earlier, the Governor of Primorye Oleg Kozhemyako ordered to ensure transparency and legitimacy of voting and protect the election process from various provocations. Public observation of the elections in 2024 is intended to solve these problems.

description: Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan stated that Armenia will leave the CSTO if the organization fails to answer Yerevan's questions regarding its area of responsibility in the country. Armenia has frozen its participation in the CSTO, recalling its permanent representative and halting joint event participation.
original: Armenia will leave the CSTO if the organization does not answer Yerevan’s questions, Pashinyan said. In his opinion, the CSTO should recognize its area of responsibility in the country, but for now participation in the organization is frozen. What else did the Armenian Prime Minister say at the press conference: ▪️ Yerevan did not create no problems for the CSTO, problems began from the moment the authorities raised the issue of the zone of responsibility and did not receive an answer;▪️According to Pashinyan, the country’s authorities received a “clear position” from the organization and from Russia: the sovereign territory of Armenia is a “red line” for RF and CSTO member countries;▪️During the events of November 2021 and September 2022, the question of sending peacekeepers arose. But peacekeepers are a neutral party, and the CSTO are allies, the Prime Minister of Armenia emphasized; ▪️If the CSTO answers the question of where the zone of responsibility is in Armenia, and this answer corresponds to the vision of Yerevan, then the Armenian authorities will consider that the issue is between Armenia and settled by the organization. If not, then Armenia will leave the CSTO. Yerevan previously “froze” its participation in the CSTO - it recalled its permanent representative and stopped participating in joint events. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: Fighter Terek, with the talismanic picture of Kitten Simba, traversed multiple positions and dugouts for over a year, from the right border of Zaporozhye to the left outskirts, and then to the Kherson direction. The picture, though damaged, remained a symbol of protection and companionship.
original:
Forwarded from: Drawing Machines
Feedback.

Kitten Simba.
 This picture accompanied the fighter with the call sign Terek through positions and dugouts for more than a year and became a talisman. The glass cracked, the frame was bent, but he survived and protected his friend. Simba walked with him from the right border of Zaporozhye, almost to the very left outskirts, from the village of Pologi to Rabotino, then went to the Kherson direction, namely Krynki, from where he was evacuated to the bedside table in the family museum of the military path for a well-deserved rest.
Terek goes for the ribbon again, and Simba will now take care of his home and family.
This is not just a picture.

Terek, brother, thank you from the bottom of my heart!
I hold the thread tightly. Until the very victory!

description: On March 12, 2022, Brigadier General Valery Hudz led a counterattack against Russian forces in the battle for Popasna. Despite being outnumbered, Hudz's quick and decisive actions pushed the Russians back, restoring the situation temporarily. However, he was mortally wounded by a Russian tank shell during the battle.
original:
Forwarded from: BUTUSOV PLUS
Exactly two years ago, on March 12, 2022, in the battle for the city of Popasna, one of the real Ukrainian combat commanders - Brigadier General of the 24th Mechanized Brigade Valery Hudz - died a hero's death. He just received an order to be assigned to his native brigade, returned to it, and immediately faced a difficult situation - the enemy stormed the suburbs of Popasnoi with significantly superior forces, tried to gain a foothold in the built-up area, the Russians could only be knocked out by quick counterattacks. Gudz immediately created an assault squad from units of the 24th and 79th amphibious assault brigades. And Colonel Hudz himself prepared and led the counterattack.

There were no Starlinks or Maviks yet, and Hudz decided to direct the battle directly from the order of battle, to see the situation with his own eyes and to give the fighters only such tasks as they were capable of performing, to immediately react to changes in maneuverable combat, so that the interaction worked in attack, and not somewhere in the headquarters on paper.

Gudz has always acted this way - and he started the war in 2014 as a platoon commander, and he had several Russian soldiers on his personal account since 2014, and he repeatedly engaged in close combat.
A quick and decisive counterattack pushed the Russians back from Popasnoi, and the situation was restored for a while. But at the very end of the battle, Valery Hudz was mortally wounded by a shell from a Russian tank. He died leading the attack as a true Ukrainian hero who was a role model and father to all his subordinates and enjoyed absolute authority and respect in the army.

An outstanding warrior, a real Ukrainian hero, who did everything possible for Ukraine and our victory. Eternal memory.

As part of the national project “Culture”, 10 libraries have been modernized in Vladivostok since 2019. Computer equipment, equipment for working with virtual and augmented reality, projectors, 3D printers, e-books, interactive information stands, software, and transformable mobile furniture were purchased for them. One of them, the Chekhov library, was inspected by public observers today. They looked at the list of events that are held in the library on an ongoing basis, and also inquired about new book releases.

People's inspectors noted the active life that libraries now have, because now they are not just a repository of books - they are large cultural and educational centers.#Nationalproject#Library#Culture of Vladivostok

Forwarded from: Real Gladkov

⠀
We stopped at the regional hospital, examined the damage, and spoke with the contractor. After we calculate the cost, we immediately begin work - we restore the roof, facade and windows.

description: Sergei Kiriyenko, Deputy Head of the Russian Presidential Administration, visited Avdeevka alongside Denis Pushilin, Head of the DPR. They distributed humanitarian aid, including bread, bottled gas, gasoline, and SIM cards, to local residents. Kiriyenko and Pushilin also inspected the Avdeevka coking plant, assessing the damage.

Sergei Kiriyenko visited Avdeevka, said the head of the DPR Denis Pushilin.

The deputy head of the Russian Presidential Administration spoke with local residents. Together with Pushilin, they handed over humanitarian aid to citizens. According to him, they will be provided with a systematic supply of bread, bottled gas and gasoline for generators. They will also be provided with SIM cards from the republican operator Phoenix.

Pushilin and Kiriyenko inspected the Avdeevka coking plant. The damage will still be assessed, but it has not suffered such critical destruction."And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections in Russia. Stories about heroes from different eras: The semi-finals of the creative competition “We are the heirs of Victory!” took place in Sevastopol. This year the project celebrates its 10th anniversary. Each team presented its own vision of the competition theme. But in any production there was a connection between times. The participants spoke about the fates of different people - veterans of the Great Patriotic War, soldiers of the North Military District, child heroes. description: Due to the crisis in the Red Sea, Russian Railways expects an increase in profits as demand for transportation of goods from Asia to Europe on Russian railways has sharply increased. Companies such as DHL, RailGate Europe, and Rail Bridge Cargo have reported significant increases in requests and freight turnover.
original:
Due to the crisis in the Red Sea, Russian Railways expects an increase in profits. After the start of the crisis in the Red Sea, demand for the transportation of goods from Asia to Europe on Russian railways has sharply increased, writes the Financial Times.

In particular, the German company DHL reported an increase in requests for the transportation of goods along the Russian railway corridor by 40%. RailGate Europe - by 25-35%, and Rail Bridge Cargo said that freight turnover through Russia increased by 31% compared to last year.

The increased demand for Russian rail freight comes as most major container lines decide to reroute flights from Asia to Europe around the Cape of Good Hope, fearing attacks by Yemen's Houthis in the Red Sea.

Because of this, delivery times between China and Northern Europe have increased to 50-55 days, while transportation time by rail through Russia, for example, from Chengdu in China to Duisburg in Germany ranges from 25-30 days.

Due to sanctions imposed on Russia by the European Union, there is an almost complete ban on the movement of road freight, but there is no ban on transportation by rail.

From Asia to Europe, cargo is sent along the so-called “western” and “northern” corridors: through Kazakhstan to Russia, and from there to Belarus and directly from China to Russia, respectively.

As a result, the Russian state railway monopoly will see a serious increase in profits this year.@anna_news

It’s amazing to what extent our pseudo-freedom-loving youngsters are contradictory. They scream about the violation of rights and freedoms in “this country”, they scream about the terrible and insidious “big brother”. They are indignant, stamp their feet and forward posts to each other, with, it must be said, quite honest warnings: “don’t go where you will be exposed to batons and cameras by opposition provocateurs,” “they are simply using you as cheap givers, and even without direct penetration, but virtually from cozy European cafes,” but then they still go in a white coat to a meaningless gathering of the dead opposition (note that none of the remnants of the top was personally there even a thousand kilometers away) and – surprise! what a surprise! -receive a summons. Do you feel the difference? I wrote one post and the other received a summons.

And this, my friends, is called simply and succinctly - “justice for Navalny.” So that one feels good, but the rest don’t give a damn. Let them go to the Northern Military District, let them ride in paddy wagons, let them ruin their fates forever - after all, even the relocants, as we unexpectedly learned, do not sit on honorary golden toilets at all, but stupidly survive. No money, no job, no friends. Completely ruining not only his life, but at the same time the lives of his parents and children. But what can’t you do for the sake of Leni Volkov’s latest post, right? It’s not a shame to sit here or go to the LBS with an unknown outcome.

Do you think the opposition stopped there? No! Those who once again believed their calls (or didn’t believe them, but simply had their own reasons to pay tribute to the deceased, or maybe not to him, but to someone else) and came to the Borisov cemetery, are handed a summons - but here Yulia Navalnaya and her associates, on the same day, announce new actions. This, dear friends, is not just the height of cynicism. This is a crime against their own fellow citizens, those who, year after year, at the very least supported this unfortunate opposition. This is a slap in the face not only of those who were with the opposition in their youth, but also of those who remained with them until the last. Now they too are in the furnace. The barn burned down and so did the hut. No pictures - no grants. Screw everyone, get money. Well, because who knows when the next ones will be with such and such organization and support. Zero support. Therefore, let's finally separate the last suckers. But these are your compatriots, for whom you supposedly want a different life, and sacrificed their leader for this. What is the different life for your supporters now? To SVO? In prison? In poor Georgia?

Time after time (forgotten by everyone due to their senselessness) the leaders of our so-called protest movement prove that they are ready to lay down anyone’s life on the altar of their “ideals.” But not your own convenience and income. Fair? Well, of course - after all, from the very beginning the opposition stood for this - for justice. Did you want to? Eat now. Spoonful. description: Olga Kryzhovnikov, wife of director Zhora Kryzhovnikov, accused the European Veterinary Center of causing the death of her dog, Maltipoo Palma, during a BAL test under anesthesia. The anesthesiologist allegedly chose a tube that was too large, touching the vagus nerve and causing cardiac arrest.
original:
Forwarded from: SHOT CHECK
The wife of director Zhora Kryzhovnikov blamed the European Veterinary Center for the death of her dog.

Maltipoo Palma was coughing a lot, and owner Olga was worried. I decided to check the dog and took him to the European Veterinary Center. Palma needed a BAL test (this is when tubes are inserted into the bronchi to check the airways). The analysis is done under anesthesia, but a year ago Palma already underwent the same test in another clinic, so Olga agreed. There were no signs of trouble; the veterinarians assured Olga that everything would go well. But during anesthesia, Palma’s heart stopped. According to Olga, this happened because the tube chosen for the analysis was too large; it touched the vagus nerve, which caused cardiac arrest. Allegedly, this is how the anesthesiologist explained the situation to her.

Olga is crushed by grief. For him and Zhora, Palma was like a beloved child. For several days, veterinarians fought to save the maltipoo’s life, but nothing came of it. The tragedy happened on March 2, and until now, according to Olga, anesthesiologist Egor Surgai, who, in her opinion, made a fatal mistake, works at the European Veterinary Center. Olga also told SHOT Verka that the same victims write to her - former clients who lost their pets in the same center.

Anesthesiologist Yegor Surgai does not want to talk to journalists. The European Veterinary Center also refused to comment on the SHOT Verification of the death of the Kryzhovnikov family’s pet.

By the way, we filmed a whole episode about unscrupulous veterinarians. Watch it at this link so as not to fall into the hands of charlatans. SHOT CHECK Subscribe!

description: The development of the IL-76 aircraft faced a significant challenge in designing the rear fuselage with a large inclined cargo hatch. The solution involved creating a configuration that allowed for fast loading and unloading of cargo from the tail side, as well as ensuring the necessary strength and rigidity of the rear fuselage.
original:
Forwarded from: IL-76 Crew
Designing the rear fuselage with a large inclined cargo hatch became one of the main problems in the development of the aircraft. The creation of a rear inclined cargo hatch, providing the ability to dump heavy bulky cargo on platforms using the parachute fall method, required ensuring that the height of the cargo hatch in the clear (in flight) was close to the height of the cargo compartment.
As a result of an analysis of the fuselage layouts of various military transport aircraft, a configuration of the rear fuselage section was chosen for the Il-76, which ensured free and fast loading of the aircraft from the tail side, as well as free exit of cargo during parachute landing.
Research carried out at TsAGI on dropping high-dimensional cargo on platforms using parachutes showed the possibility of reducing the height of the cargo hatch opening in the area of the ends of the doors from 3.4 to 3.0 m, due to which the construction height of the power elements of the rear fuselage on which the keel is attached was increased .
To ensure the necessary strength of the rear part of the fuselage, it was necessary to make a special rigidity (upper closed contour), resting on the side beams - reinforced longitudinal elements of a box-section that limit the hatch cutout in the rear part of the fuselage.#history

description: The second day of Maslenitsa, Zaigrysh, marked the beginning of festive fun. Youth engaged in games, friendly competitions, and traditional activities like sledding, horse-drawn cart riding, and snowball fights. The day aimed to bring young people together, allowing them to find potential partners and build strong unions.
original:
The second day of Maslenitsa - “Zaigrysh” In Rus', the second day of Maslenitsa was called “Zaigrysh”. In 2024 it falls on March 12th. From that moment on, the noisy festive fun began. If on Monday the ice slides, swings, carousels and tents for celebrations were just being erected, then on Tuesday the youth were already making full use of them for games and friendly competitions.

From the very morning, boys and girls went sledding down the hills. It was believed that the more fun this fun was, the more happiness the youth would expect in the future. Anyone who was sad during “Zigrysh”, according to legend, risked spending the entire next year in melancholy.

Another traditional entertainment on this day was horse-drawn cart riding. The boys demonstrated their dexterity and courage in relay races and competitions: tug-of-war, conquering a pole smeared with grease, riding a pair of swings and other activities. During the day, boys and girls built snow forts and played snowballs, and in the evening they gathered together to communicate, sing songs and treat themselves to hot pancakes with hearty fillings.

All this was started in order to give young people the opportunity to take a closer look at each other and meet their soulmate. Hence another meaning of the word “flirting” - the time when guys and girls flirt with each other, choosing potential brides and grooms. It was believed that the sympathy that arose on this day could result in a strong union.

In addition, the couple had enough time to make a final decision about marriage, because after Maslenitsa Lent began, during which it was forbidden to get married. Wedding festivities resumed only on Krasnaya Gorka, the first Sunday after Easter. Marriage on this day, according to legend, promised the young people a long and happy family life.

On the second day of Maslenitsa week they also began to invite people over for pancakes. Relatives, friends, neighbors and mummers were invited to the festive table, and they went from house to house with congratulations. People believed that the more guests and the more plentiful the food, the more successful the year would be for the hosts. It was also an excellent opportunity to meet the parents of a potential bride or groom.

According to folk traditions, on the second day of Maslenitsa week you should not be sad, lie, envy or quarrel with loved ones, as this can lead to protracted conflicts and misfortunes. In the old days, during Zaigrysh people tried not to be alone and not spend the whole day at home, so as not to miss out on their happiness. Also on this day they put off all serious financial matters and did not talk about their dreams. People believed that voiced nightmares would quickly come true, but good dreams, on the contrary, would never come true.

Pancakes are a traditional Maslenitsa treat, without which it is impossible to imagine this holiday. In Rus', a circle of hot, ruddy dough symbolized the sun and the imminent arrival of spring.

You can bake pancakes from the first day of Maslenitsa until the end of the holiday. At the same time, according to legend, the first batch should be given to the poor or treated to neighbors in order to remember the ancestors. However, in the modern world it is not necessary to follow old traditions. The main thing is to enjoy the holiday atmosphere and get a charge of positive emotions.@Gorlowka_now

event: Extortion Attempts on St. Petersburg Businesses
description: Strong construction and financial companies in St. Petersburg received similar email messages over the past couple of weeks, hinting at lending to affiliated entities, fund withdrawals, and illegal activities. The senders, claiming to be from popular Telegram channels like Nezygar, offered cooperation options and threatened to publish negative content unless paid.
original:
The editors of 47news have a number of examples where, over the past couple of weeks, strong construction and financial companies in St. Petersburg received almost the same type of messages by email. Our interlocutors from the business community are not ready to comment openly, but provided sample proposals.
“We haven’t accepted the order yet, we don’t have complete information. We have been told about lending to legal entities affiliated with the owners, withdrawal of funds abroad, illegal withdrawal of funds,” this is the beginning of similar and extremely vague hints. So, for example, in one case the sender listed as TG "Nezygar". This is one of the most famous political channels on Telegram, publishing news, analytics, forecasts and expert comments claiming to be insiders. Started work in 2017. There is no reliable information about the owner of the channel. At various times, they included political strategists, journalists and “saw” the Kremlin’s footprint. “We would like to agree on options for cooperation before taking an order,” the anonymous text continues. What follows is a seemingly journalistic approach: “We are turning to you for comments.” However, there is no hiding here, saying, “Of course, we cannot guarantee that your comments will be included in the texts in full.”
An allegedly advertising story is also presented: “You order from us after the order is completed, texts as a response.” (Read, doubling the amount in the game). And finally, the recipients reach the frontal offer.
“Block on the negative” with an emphasis on reputation: “The block is not overbought.”
47news turned to the administration of the Nezygar channel (there is an email and a bot for “sponsorship projects”). We asked if the channel had encountered the phenomenon of doppelgängers and, if so, what the reaction or actions were. The answer turned out to be extremely categorical. We quote it verbatim.
“We ask for your attention. The editors receive signals about certain “requests”, “offers for cooperation and purchase of blocks for publication”, placement in Nezygar’s grid. Offers come from third-party mailboxes and through telegram accounts containing a mention of our channel. Please note, "that Nezygar's editorial team has a single communication channel (which is indicated below). The editors do not make requests, do not offer placement in channel networks, and certainly do not offer blocks and stop lists for their publications. Also, we do not delete previously published materials."
In our cases, feedback is indicated only by text in WhatsApp and Telegram to UK numbers. (However, these can also be ordered in Russia). 47news tried to find out the details, tariff and method of payment, as well as guarantees and for how long the block is placed, from the direct senders. There has been no response yet either in the messenger or by mail. They didn’t answer the call either. https://m.47news.ru/articles/246916/47news “We haven’t taken the order yet.” How well-known telegram channels extort negative blocks from businesses St. Petersburg companies began to receive ultimatums. The newsletter indicates the addresses of popular channels in the “cart”, but a meeting or dialogue by voice is cut off...

description: The Ministry of Veterans Affairs of Ukraine has launched a program to finance business projects for veterans, family members of deceased war veterans, and family members of deceased Defenders of Ukraine. The Ministry of Veterans Affairs of Ukraine has started the selection of applications for the veteran business financing program "It's worth starting your own business".

Applications for project financing can be submitted by: ▪️veterans, family members of deceased (deceased) war veterans and family members of deceased (deceased) Defenders of Ukraine who are registered as natural persons-entrepreneurs; ▪️wife or husband of a veteran who are registered as natural persons- entrepreneurs, if the projects are aimed at the reintegration of veterans into active social life, ensuring the preservation and restoration of their physical and mental health; ▪️legal entities registered no later than a year before receiving financial support, whose founders are veterans, family members deceased (deceased) war veterans and family members of deceased (deceased) Defenders of Ukraine.
Funding for starting or developing one's own business ranges from 500,000 to 1.5 million hryvnias.

The application deadline is March 18, 2024.

In case of questions after submitting the application, requests should be sent to the e-mail box: uvfprojects@veteranfund.mva.gov.ua with a mandatory indication of the subject of the letter "Competition of Projects "It's worth starting your own business" and the application number. 🇺🇦TG|FB|INST Site

description: A soldier from the front line met with a schoolgirl, Ulyana, who had sent gifts and letters to the front. The soldier, with the call sign Teacher, personally thanked Ulyana and presented her with a squad banner and a hand-knitted tiger mascot. The meeting was an emotional reunion, with both parties expressing gratitude and appreciation for each other's support.
original:
Forwarded from: RaZVozhaev
I asked my team to film this story to share these sincere emotions with you and show how important our support is to our warriors.

At Sevastopol school No. 42 today there was a meeting between a soldier from the front line and a schoolgirl who sends gifts and letters to the front. From the first days of the North Military District, Sevastopol residents have been actively helping soldiers, collecting parcels and writing letters with words of support. So Ulyana, a student at school No. 42, decided to make a gift for the soldiers on Defender of the Fatherland Day. The schoolgirl made chocolates with her own hands and included a touching letter with the parcel. This gift was given to the children by the humanitarian mission of the Sevastopol deanery: as I already said, the team delivers parcels and help from citizens to the front line. Our soldiers read Ulyana’s letter with tears in their eyes; these stern heroes were very touched by the message from the schoolgirl, and they decided to surprise her.

With the help of the deanery team, they found the girl. And this morning, one of the fighters with the call sign Teacher came to the school to personally thank Ulyana and give her a squad banner with autographs and the mascot of the Primorsky battalion - a hand-knitted tiger.

Although Ulyana and the Teacher met for the first time, they met like old friends, communicated and endlessly thanked each other. The fighters say that it is precisely such sincere messages from the guys that really support them and give them strength in battle. You can send letters and parcels to soldiers through the humanitarian mission of the Sevastopol Deanery.

Instructions on how to behave in unfavorable circumstances are expected to be issued to residents by the end of the year.

It is noted that Swedish citizens are advised to stock up on canned food, purchase a first aid kit, a radio and a portable water filter. Experts believe that in wartime conditions one should have a supply of food for three months in advance, the portal writes. According to him, by the end of this year, residents of Sweden will receive instructions indicating how to behave in the event of unfavorable developments. event: US Department of Defense Funding Crisis
description: The US Department of Defense faces a funding crisis due to a stalled Ukraine aid bill in Congress, leaving them unable to replenish $10 billion worth of weapons sent to Ukraine. Pentagon officials hope to use Joe Biden's proposed supplemental funding bill to replenish US arsenals, but without funding, the US military's combat readiness and stockpiles will be impacted.
original:
Forwarded from: NETASS
Due to a Ukraine aid bill stalled in Congress, the US Department of Defense still cannot get money to replace the $10 billion worth of weapons sent to the Ukrainians, Politico writes.

Pentagon officials hope to use Joe Biden's proposed supplemental funding bill, which also includes money for Israel and Taiwan, to replenish US arsenals.

However, a senior Defense Department official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said that if the US Department of Defense does not receive funding to replenish its reserves, the US military will ultimately feel the consequences of this “gaping hole”.

“We have not been able, with the funding available today—and a large amount of additional funding is now expected—to make up for everything that we have already provided to Ukraine,” the unnamed official said. “So if we can’t get new funding, it will have some impact on our own combat readiness and our own stockpiles.”NETASS

description: The city of Avdeevka has been captured, with significant destruction to buildings and infrastructure. Despite the devastation, the Church of Mary Magdalene remains standing, with only minor damage to the Altar and stained glass windows. The church, affiliated with the Moscow Patriarchate, has maintained its loyalty to Moscow for over 1000 years.
original:
Forwarded from: Kotsnews
Afterword to the capture of Avdeevka

“Don’t believe in miracles after this,” my comrade, an officer of one of the special forces units, crosses himself.

In his SUV, we drive along the ruined street of the multi-storey 9th quarter of Avdeevka to the Church of Mary Magdalene, which splashes its whiteness in the sun across the torn brick and concrete mess around. Nine-story buildings turned inside out without walls, as if naked, look like bedrooms and children's rooms at the stumps of charred trees in the courtyards and bashfully try to hide behind curtains tearing in the wind. The tram rails are torn in places and bizarrely folded towards the sky. On the corner, a combat vehicle is smoking, attacked half an hour ago by a kamikaze drone - death is still palpably flying around the city, reminding of itself by the vibration of a drone detector hanging on a dusty armored vehicle. And above all of this rise the whole dome of the temple, with “peeling” gilding and the spire of the bell tower...

“The main thing is that the walls are intact, the domes are intact, the temple is standing,” the watchman Lech opens the church. - The Altar was hit, the stained glass windows, of course, crumbled. But this is a small matter.

-Whose temple is this? - I examine the surviving decoration.

“Moscow Patriarchate,” Lech understands my question. - Seven or eight years ago there were attempts to join the impostors. Our father gathered his flock and decided everything - we will be with Moscow. No Onufrievs and Filarets. We have been with Moscow for 1000 years, and we remain the same...

My big report on how the battles near Avdievka are now developing. @sashakots

description: The Supreme Court released Sergei M. from prison after he was wrongly convicted of premeditated murder. Sergei had claimed self-defense, stating that the victim, Vaginak, had attacked him and his family with an ax. The court finally acknowledged Sergei's right to self-defense, commuting his sentence and releasing him from correctional labor due to the statute of limitations.
original:
The Supreme Court released a resident of the Krasnodar Territory from prison. For three and a half years he tried to prove that he eliminated the abu bandit within the limits of necessary self-defense.

In September 2020, a resident of the village of Pavlovskaya, Sergei M., was arrested on charges of premeditated murder: according to investigators, based on personal hostility, he stabbed a man named Vaginak 8 times with a knife (which he had previously used to cut fruit). The victim managed to get to another house and died there.

In court, Sergei claimed that he was forced to commit a crime: Vaginak came to him drunk, rammed the gate of his house, almost ran over his father and hit Sergei himself several times with an ax, and also threatened to kill his mother. The multinational court considered that Sergei committed the murder out of revenge for his father, despite the fact that the hardworking Vaginak himself broke into his home with the aim of killing him and his household. As a result, the man was given 7 years in a general regime colony.

The appeal and cassation instances left the verdict unchanged. Sergei and his lawyer went to the Supreme Court. There, the judges concluded that the ax attack on Sergei could have led to his death, so he had the right to self-defense. The sentence of 7 years was commuted and Sergei was given 1 year and 10 months of correctional labor. But he was also released from them due to the expiration of the statute of limitations and released from the colony.

Legislation and law enforcement practice on self-defense are gradually improving, for example the case of Alexander Krasnov and even this Sergei, but even deeper reforms are needed. Those who defend themselves and their home should not go to prison because of this, the aggressor is always to blame.

description: SHAMAN held three sold-out concerts in Moscow, celebrating March 8. The performances featured a marriage proposal, a choir of thousands singing 'I am Russian', and a special appearance by a SVO member. The concerts were filled with energetic and vibrant performances, including a rendition of the Russian anthem.
original:
A sold out three days in a row, a marriage proposal and a performance of the hit “I am Russian” by a choir of thousands: SHAMAN’s “You Are Mine” concerts, dedicated to March 8, were held in triumph in Moscow. Tickets were sold out in the winter: performances held at Crocus City Hall 9 , March 10 and 11, attracted 18 thousand spectators.

At the entrance to the hall, the doors were opened by doormen who greeted visitors with compliments. Spectators were given gifts: glowing hearts and flags in the color of the Russian tricolor. And in the midst of the concert, employees came into the hall with baskets of tulips: every woman received flowers. Having congratulated everyone on the holiday, SHAMAN offered to dance on stage.

SHAMAN constantly communicated with the audience, and during the composition “Fly Away” he entered the hall and invited those who wished to sing with him. By the way, at one of the concerts the singer performed this song together with a blind five-year-old boy. We met Roma at one of my autumn solo concerts in the Kremlin. Then he told his mother that he dreamed of singing “Fly Away” with me. And I’m glad that I’ve already been able to fulfill the dream of this talented guy twice,” said SHAMAN.

The surprise of one of the days was the appearance on stage of a SVO member: SHAMAN gave him a microphone, and the military man asked a very beautiful girl to come on stage with him. Dasha, losing my leg was a difficult test for me, but meeting you was a real miracle. You are a ray of light that has filled my life with joy and hope. Your love and care have made me stronger. I love you very much. “Marry me,” said the military man. When the girl answered him “Yes,” the whole hall stood up and shouted to the lovers: “Bitter!” your love."

The culmination of the incredibly energetic and vibrant performances was the performance of the hit “I am Russian” in front of an audience of thousands: the audience easily picked up the famous tune. Together with SHAMAN, the audience sang the composition “Alive” and the Russian anthem that concluded all performances.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The United Russia party's humanitarian mission in the Kherson region has distributed around 7,500 tons of cargo since March 2022, providing food assistance to over 250,000 people, including residents of 130 villages. Volunteers also delivered books, medicine, and basic necessities to populated areas near the combat contact line and to frontline fighters.
original:
Forwarded from: Kastyukevich Live
In Genichesk we gathered to say thank you to those who have been with us all this time and remain with us shoulder to shoulder!

Since March 2022, the humanitarian mission of the United Russia party in the Kherson region has received and distributed about 7.5 thousand tons of various cargo. Over 250 thousand people received food assistance, including residents of 130 villages. Volunteers provided libraries with books in Russian, brought children's literature and primers to children, food, medicine and basic necessities. Including to populated areas in the immediate vicinity of the line of combat contact. In addition to government support, the humanitarian mission delivered aid to frontline fighters. Humanitarian supplies came from all over Russia.

I am grateful to everyone who daily contributes to the activities of the humanitarian mission. Not in word, but in deed, it proves that we are together and will help everyone we can reach. People in the Kherson region believe in us, they come up with a wide variety of difficult problems precisely because we do not turn away and help and participate in solving them.

The humanitarian mission of "United Russia" in the Kherson region is not slowing down. Now it is focused on working out targeted problems, as well as ensuring the smooth operation of all spheres of life and the speedy integration of the Kherson region into the Russian Federation. # United Russia # EP84 # Kherson region # ER helps

event: Russian Senator Advocates for Crimea's Return
description: Sergei Tsekov, a member of the Federation Council Committee on International Affairs, stated that Russia has the right to cancel the illegal decision to transfer Crimea to Ukraine in 1954. He emphasized that the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR did not have the authority to make this transfer.
original:
Russia, as the legal successor of the USSR, has the right to cancel the illegal decision to transfer Crimea, said Sergei Tsekov, a member of the Federation Council Committee on International Affairs.
 
He is one of the authors of the bill. In a conversation with RT, Tsekov noted that the decision was carried out with a lot of violations: the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR did not have the right to transfer the peninsula to the Ukrainian SSR.
 
“This gives us the opportunity to talk with normal countries that respect the Russian Federation, to explain in general what actually happened to Crimea in 1954. I believe that the illegal decisions of that period are cancelled, can be cancelled, should be cancelled,” the senator emphasized.
 
In addition to the bill, parliamentarians also addressed the Constitutional Court on this issue, he said.

description: On this day in 1989, a Soviet MiG-23M fighter jet, piloted by Colonel Nikolai Skuridin, experienced engine failure and was abandoned. However, the aircraft continued flying on autopilot, crossing Poland, the GDR, West Germany, and the Netherlands before crashing into a residential building in Bellegeme, Belgium, killing one person.
original:
Forwarded from: AviaNews
35 years ago, the “unmanned” MiG-23 flew halfway across Europe. On this day in 1989, a Soviet fighter jet flew halfway across Europe and crashed into a residential building in Bellegeme, Belgium, killing one person.

The MiG-23M from the 871st Pomeranian Red Banner Fighter Aviation Regiment of the Northern Group of Forces of the Soviet Union was piloted by 1st class pilot Colonel Nikolai Skuridin.

At the 41st second of flight at an altitude of 150 meters, there was a sudden decrease in engine speed, a bang in the left air intake, a drop in thrust and the fighter descended. Colonel Skuridin took all this to mean the engine had stopped. Then he acted according to the instructions: he reported the refusal, received the go-ahead to eject, turned the fighter towards the sea and pulled the handles of the catapult.

The fighter itself, held by automation, continued its flight. It flew over Poland, the GDR, the Federal Republic of Germany, the Netherlands until it fell on the territory of Belgium. Large material written two years ago for leisurely reading here. @AviaNews

description: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) detained the wife of a former Party of Regions official who was spying for the FSB in Vinnytsia. She was tasked with identifying airfields, anti-aircraft missiles, medical facilities, and military routes to prepare for missile and drone strikes. The SBU's prompt response prevented enemy attacks on strategic infrastructure.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained the wife of an "ex-regional" who praised Putin and spied for the FSB in Vinnytsia.
 
The female figure turned out to be the wife of a former official of the Party of Regions, who headed the local district council until 2015.
 
On the instructions of the Russian special service, she tried to identify airfields with combat aircraft and helicopters of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, as well as to find out the presence of anti-aircraft missiles near aviation facilities.
 
In addition, the attacker was interested in the geolocations of medical facilities where Ukrainian defenders are treated, and scouted the routes of military echelons.
 
If the information was received, the aggressor planned to use it to prepare missile and drone strikes on the region.
 
As a result of counter-subversive measures, SBU employees promptly exposed the Russian agent, and then "step-by-step" documented her criminal activities and detained her.
 
Thanks to the prompt response of the Security Service, it was possible to prevent enemy attacks on strategic infrastructure in the region.
 
Also, during the investigation, it was established that the person involved from the anonymous account in "Odnoklasnyky" called for support for Putin and justified the invasion of Russian troops into Ukraine.
 
According to the investigation, it was precisely because of her anti-Ukrainian activity on the banned social network that she came into the attention of the FSB and was recruited.
 
During the search of the detainee's apartment, mobile phones and a tablet, which she used to communicate with the FSB, were seized.
 
So far, the investigators of the Security Service have notified the suspect of suspicion under five articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator is currently in custody. She faces life imprisonment with confiscation of property.
 
Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in Vinnytsia region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

original:
Two drug dealers were detained in the Adler district of Sochi. This was reported in the press service of the resort's Internal Affairs Directorate. On Verkhneizvestinskaya Street, police noticed two students of Gainutdin who were intoxicated. One of them threw a pack of cigarettes onto the ground. It contained packages of methylephedrone.

There were also synthetic drugs in the apartment of the 22-year-old multinationals. Law enforcement also found scales and packaging. Using the coordinates in the drug dealers' phones, they found the hiding places.

In total, the police seized about 50 grams of prohibited substances. A criminal case has been opened against the suspects. They are in custody.

description: Presidential elections will take place on March 17, 2024, in the Russian Federation. Russian citizens residing or staying in Cambodia can exercise their right to vote at polling station No. 8152, located at the Russian Embassy in Phnom Penh.
original:
Dear citizens of Russia!
We remind you that presidential elections will take place on March 17, 2024
Russian Federation.
It will be possible to exercise your right to vote in
Show more
Sunday at polling station No. 8152, located on the territory of the Russian Embassy in Cambodia at the address Phnom Penh, Sothearos Blvd., 213 (Samdech Sothearos Blvd., 213, Phnom Penh), entrance on the west side.
The polling station will be open on March 17, 2024 from 8:00 to 20:00 (local time).
Contacts of the precinct election commission: +855 23 210 931, ruscamb@mid.ru.
Citizens of the Russian Federation who have reached the age of 18 and are permanently residing or temporarily staying in Cambodia are invited to exercise their constitutional right to express their will.
The issuance of voting papers will be carried out upon presentation of a passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation, identifying the identity of a citizen of the Russian Federation outside the Russian Federation (general foreign, diplomatic or service passport), and in case of its loss - a certificate of entry (return) to the Russian Federation.
In order to ensure the safety of voters and members of the precinct election commission on voting day, enhanced security and control measures will be taken. Please understand that bringing any bags (including ladies' bags) or electronic devices into the polling station is prohibited (storage areas will be provided at the entrance).
Additional information is available on the website of the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation at the link: http://www.cikrf.ru/analog/prezidentskiye-vybory-2024..

description: Two teenagers, aged 14 and 13, brutally attacked a 58-year-old man in an abandoned building on Sofievskaya Street in Berdyansk. They used their feet, hands, and a crutch to inflict severe injuries, resulting in the victim's death in the hospital.

A fourteen-year-old resident of Berdyansk will appear in court on charges of causing grievous harm resulting in death. According to the investigation, on the evening of July 13, 2023, he and a thirteen-year-old friend attacked a 58-year-old man in an abandoned building on Sofievskaya Street. The victim died in the intensive care unit of the Berdyansk city hospital. The senior accused pleaded guilty, and his case with an approved indictment was sent to court. The second offender was placed on preventive registration - he has not reached the age of criminal responsibility.

It is the latter that is called the main obstacle to the Democrats’ plan, the chances of which are called minimal.

description: The Stavropol Ministry of Education is criticized for its video celebrating National Unity Day in Russia, which features non-Russian youth in national costumes and singing in their own languages, with little representation of ethnic Russians or Russian symbols.
original:
The Stavropol Ministry of Education is trying to absurdly justify its poor video.
Like, if we take out a magnifying glass, then in ultraHD4K resolution we can see Orthodox crosses on churches.

Let me remind you that the complaints about the video did not start with the crosses. And because in your video dedicated to the Day of National Unity in Russia there are actually no Russians or Russian symbols.

A crowd of non-Russian youth walks around in their national costumes and hums songs in their own languages. Moreover, among them there are many representatives of non-indigenous peoples of Russia: Uzbeks, Kyrgyz, Tajiks and Azerbaijanis. Why don’t the Scots, Flemings and Japanese sing songs on National Unity Day? They have the same attitude to this holiday as the Transcaucasians and Central Asians.

It turns out that the Ministry of Education of the Stavropol Territory does not know the history of Russia?
Let me remind you that on National Unity Day we celebrate the victory of ethnic Russian Orthodox people over European invaders. No other nationalities, except for the Great Russians, were involved in the militia of Minin and Pozharsky, which repelled the aggression of the Polish-Hungarian-Lithuanian-Little Russian army. Moreover, it was a religious war in which we defended the Orthodox Faith from a union with Catholicism, which would have happened if the Catholic and Uniate interventionists had won.

This is a purely Russian Orthodox holiday. On Purim, Jews do not invite Russians with kosovorotkas and balalaikas to celebrate their important national and religious date with them.

I will also remind the Stavropol Ministry of Defense that in your region 80 percent of the population is Russian. Therefore, they should be presented proportionally in the video.
Three quarters of the video we should see Russian girls and boys in Russian and Cossack national clothes, singing in Russian, close-ups of crosses on churches.
One quarter of the video can be shown to the indigenous Caucasian and Turkic peoples of Russia, also living in the Stavropol Territory.

And representatives of non-indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation in their national costumes are completely inappropriate in your video. They have the same relation to our people as the Welsh or the Maori.

Students from other countries could well sing their songs in a video about Student’s Day, but a video dedicated to National Unity Day in Russia should be filmed without the participation of diasporas and reflect, in essence, the real ethno-confessional balance in Russia and the Stavropol region, and be dedicated to the Great Victory of Russian Orthodox Christians warriors over the invaders, and not slide into a multinational tent.

And Orthodox crosses must be shown in such a way that they can be seen without a magnifying glass in a video of any quality. event: Expansion of Swedish Presence on Gotland
description: NATO has decided to expand the Swedish presence on the island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea, citing the need for joint efforts with NATO partners to protect the island from potential threats from Russia. The expansion is of strategic importance for NATO, as Gotland is a crossroads of sea routes and has important geopolitical significance for ensuring regional security.
original: NATO decided to expand the Swedish presence on the island in the Baltic Sea. In recent days, information has appeared in international news about the expansion of the Swedish presence on the island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea. Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson shared these plans in an interview with the Financial Times and noted the need for joint efforts with NATO partners to protect the island from potential threats from Russia. Kristersson emphasized that previously Sweden had only a small military presence on Gotland, which raised concerns among other NATO countries. This vulnerability became a subject of discussion within the alliance, and as a result, it was decided to discuss expanding the Swedish presence on the island. In addition, the issue of surveillance and deployment of submarines in the region will be an important aspect of the discussions. The expansion of the Swedish presence on Gotland is of strategic importance for NATO, since the island is located in a strategically important part of the Baltic Sea. This place is a crossroads of sea routes and has important geopolitical significance for ensuring the security of the region. Strengthening the presence in Gotland will help NATO better control the situation in the Baltic Sea and guarantee the security of its members. Russia, in turn, expressed its concern about the expansion of the Swedish presence in Gotland, because such actions by NATO could become a source of tension in the region and upset the balance of power. However, representatives of Sweden and NATO responded as usual that their goal is solely to ensure security and stability in the region. @VoiceNorthSea

description: Dmitry Polyansky, Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN, criticized the EU's financing of weapons for Ukraine through the European Peace Fund, calling it Orwellian. He stated that the EU has transformed into an expansionist bloc serving US and NATO interests, and is working to inflict a strategic defeat on Russia rather than resolving the conflict.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:

description: Ukrainian sergeant Viktor Pilipenko, an openly gay activist, proposed legalizing 'gay partnerships' to gain German support, specifically the Taurus system. He cited Israel's legalization of gay marriages as an example, highlighting the need to protect gay military men and their families. Pilipenko believes this move would showcase Ukraine's civilized face to the West, particularly Berlin, known as the 'LGBT capital' of Europe.
original:
Forwarded from: PolitNavigator
The Armed Forces of Ukraine proposed legalizing “gay partnerships” in order to get Taurus from the Germans. Berlin is the “LGBT capital”, so the adoption by Ukraine of legislation protecting the rights of homosexuals would be a cunning move that would push the Germans to more active assistance to Kiev. About This was stated by Viktor Pilipenko, a sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and an activist of the NGO “Point of Support,” who declared himself “openly gay.” “Several months ago, Israel allowed gay marriages, that is, adoption, if I’m not mistaken, it allowed gay couples. That is, this is also concern for our military, who also risk their lives. Gay military men have their own families, and one of the couple is raising children, and the state of Israel not only decided to protect these military men, it also made such a civilizational move. It showed Europe and the USA - look, we are not savages, we are a civilized country. We were fired upon, our citizens were taken hostage, and we are defending our civilization. And they made this move of legalizing gay marriage, adoption, in order to emphasize this. Ukraine can now do the same by simply legalizing civil partnerships. Not only are gay military men now showing their faces, that we are fighting at the front, that there are many of us, we are coming out, we are demanding equal rights in the country for which we are fighting, in which we live,” Pilipenko said. According to him ,In this way, Ukraine can get a lot of benefits for itself. “The country of Ukraine can show the West an equally civilized face by simply legalizing civil partnerships, passing this law and protecting us as a social group. And we should do good, and show a positive image to the West, remind ourselves once again. Remembering, by the way, Berlin, which is, of course, the LGBT capital of Europe, we are asking Berlin for “Taurus” now! Why not remind the residents of Berlin and Germany about Ukraine as a civilized country with these steps? Why not legalize civil partnerships and enlist the support of the considerable LGBT community in the West?” suggested the VSUshnik.

event: Davankov's Team Accused of Discrediting Electoral System
description: Vladislav Davankov's team is spreading information that regions were allegedly instructed to shift votes to other candidates, attacking the legitimacy of elections and competitive voting. This approach may lead to severe consequences from the top and discredit both the candidate and the electoral system.
original:
Forwarded from: Visionary Channel
The dope of “unprecedented success” that Davankov’s headquarters created around itself through the purchase of political scientists and public pages on social networks is slowly but surely turning into a pumpkin.

After the publication of the latest pollster measurements, in which Vladislav Davankov was given a fair third or fourth place, hysterics broke out. The forms of this hysteria can come back to haunt not only the technologists who are whipping it up, but the candidate himself and even Alexei Nechaev.

Davankov’s team is pushing information (see screenshots - two posts with the same text at the same time) that the regions were allegedly given the task of shifting votes to other candidates. Such forwardings attack two key theses on which the Kremlin relies: competitive voting and the legitimacy of elections. Settlements that deny the influence of the voter himself on the result and are made in the logic of promised or not promised, deal a blow to the legitimacy of the process. Those who write and order something like this can get hit very hard from the very top.

The New People team is either deliberately pitting its candidate against the political system or out of ignorance. If the former, then this shows that the influence of foreign agents on Davankov’s headquarters remains. They say correctly that there is no need to be friends with the opposition that has moved away. But for some reason the headquarters of the “New People” stubbornly continues to do this, discrediting both itself and the electoral system as a whole.

With this approach to choosing “friends,” Davankov clearly has a place in the tail. You can accept this with pride as your first experience, or you can go down a slippery slope, onto which the candidate is clearly being pushed by “well-wishers” from his team.

event: Russia to Take Control of Ukraine-NATO Border
description: Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov stated that Russia needs to take control of Ukraine's border with Moldova, Poland, and Hungary to stop Western military aid to Ukraine. He suggested establishing military bases on the border or capturing it, emphasizing that missile attacks on trains are ineffective.
location: Ukraine-Moldova border, Ukraine-Poland border, Ukraine-Hungary border
original:
“There is no other way”: Russia will have to take control of Ukraine’s border with NATO.

To put an end to Western military aid to Ukraine, Russia will have to take control of the border with Moldova, Poland and Hungary.
 
Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov stated this on air on the Komsomolskaya Pravda radio.

“How do Western non-partners manage to supply the Ukrainian army?” asked the presenter.
 
“The border with Moldova, with Poland, with Hungary is open. What problems?
 
After all, we left Afghanistan, including because we could not close the border with Pakistan. Special forces units were created, units that carried out ambush operations and helicopter hunting, but they failed.
 
And here, in order to have control over Ukraine, it is necessary either to have military bases there on the border by agreement, and to freely monitor the border with NATO. Or capture this border.
 
But I think everything will go through negotiations, and we will have control abroad,” the military correspondent noted.
 
He emphasized that it makes no sense to launch missile attacks on trains coming from the West.

“And now the border is open, bring whatever you want, how are we going to interfere? Spend missiles on dispersed trucks and vehicles, or know exactly where they are stored and strike.
 
Now, strikes are being made on Odessa, Izmail, Kharkov, Kherson, and the Dnieper - these are warehouses. And along the road the cars stretch out, the distance between them is eighty kilometers,” added Sladkov. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456251498Vk Russia will have to take control of the Ukrainian border with NATOvk video

description: A 39-year-old woman from Izyum, who worked as a manicurist, was informed of suspicion of collaborative activity for voluntarily working with the Russian military during their occupation of the city. She assumed the role of 'assistant operative of the duty unit' in the fake police department, receiving and reporting information on crimes and events.
original:
🔷A woman from Izyum, who worked in the occupation police, was informed of suspicion 🖌️Under the procedural leadership of the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office, a 39-year-old woman was informed in absentia of suspicion of collaborative activity (Part 7 of Article 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, during the capture of the city of Izyum by the Russian military, a local resident - a manicurist - voluntarily agreed to work for the enemy.

Under the occupiers, the woman decided to change her profession and got a job at the "Izyum Police Department". The collaborator assumed the position of "assistant operative of the duty unit" in the fake police.

The woman worked from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and was also on duty once a month.

The pseudo-law enforcement officer received information about crimes and other events, processed it and reported it to the "operational duty officer".

Currently, the suspect is hiding from the investigation on the territory of the Russian Federation, the issue of declaring her wanted is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the investigators of the SU GUNP in the Kharkiv region. Operative support — Kharkiv Directorate of the DVB NPU. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: Russian State Duma deputies appealed to German parliamentarians, expressing concern over reports of Germany's potential supply of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine. They called for an objective investigation into Bundeswehr soldiers' involvement in Ukrainian military operations and urged Germany to avoid actions that could lead to armed conflict with Russia.
original:
We, Deputies of the State Duma of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation, consider it fundamentally important, timely and necessary to appeal to German parliamentarians - members of the Bundestag of the Federal Republic of Germany in connection with the publication of information about the discussion by the German military command of the supply of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine and their use by Ukrainian armed forces for strikes on critical civil infrastructure facilities on Russian territory, including the Crimean Bridge across the Kerch Strait.

<…>

From the distributed audio recording it directly follows that the task for the air force officers was set by one of the country’s highest military-political leaders, probably Defense Minister B. Pistorius.

<…>

We call on the Bundestag of the Federal Republic of Germany to conduct an objective investigation into the participation of Bundeswehr soldiers in military operations on the territory of Ukraine. In accordance with the Treaty on the Final Settlement with respect to Germany of September 12, 1990, according to which only peace will emanate from German soil, and actions that can and have the goal of destroying peace between peoples, especially preparations for offensive war, are unconstitutional and punishable .

<…>

We call on the Bundestag not to allow actions that drag Germany into an armed conflict on the side of the fascist-terrorist Ukrainian regime. The State Duma is convinced that the successful long-term experience of the Soviet-German and Russian-German settlement, the common sense of the German people and the parliamentarians expressing their will, will prevent the catastrophe of direct armed confrontation between Germany and Russia, and will bring closer the beginning of a mutually beneficial political dialogue in the name of peace and prosperity in Europe "From the appeal of the State Duma deputies to the Bundestag of the Federal Republic of Germany. Adopted unanimously today.

description: Captain Petro Shamshur, a National Guard officer, died on February 15, 2023, while fighting against Russian aggression near Kharkiv. He was posthumously awarded the Order 'For Courage' III degree by President Volodymyr Zelenskyi.
original:
🕯In memory of Captain of the National Guard Petro ShamshurPetro Shamshur was born on November 28, 1994 in the village of Desnianske, Chernihiv region. After the ninth grade, the boy entered the Chernihiv Radio Technical College, and later studied at the Kyiv Institute of Technology and Design.

But 2013 was a turning point for Peter: he withdrew his documents from the university for military service. Served in Shostka, in military unit 3032, studied at the sergeants' school in Zolochiv, Lviv region. In 2015, he entered the National Academy of National State University in Kharkiv, which he graduated in 2019.

Petro participated in the anti-terrorist operation, from 2022 - in repelling and containing the armed aggression of the Russian Federation near Kharkiv, as well as in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

On February 11, 2023, Petro left for the front line from vacation. A few days later, on February 15, the man's relatives learned that he had died.

By decree of President Volodymyr Zelenskyi No. 253/2023 of April 30 last year, the captain of the National Guard was posthumously awarded the Order "For Courage" III degree.

Eternal memory of the Hero!

On Monday morning, Greta Thunberg, along with 50 climate activists, blocked the main entrance to the Swedish Riksdag. “We are sitting here now, but we will continue to fight as long as necessary,” Greta Thunberg told reporters. According to Greta Thunberg, dressed in Palestinian clothing shawl, she and her allies are demanding an immediate reduction in emissions. “We sit here to protest against the current system, which is already leading to the death of people as a result of the climate crisis. Politicians and those in power have ignored activists, youth and researchers for decades. They give priority to short-term economic interests,” Thunberg said. description: A teacher at Volgograd College of Management and New Technologies was fired after posting photos of cacti in a work chat, which management deemed indecent. The teacher had captioned the photo with a reference to International Women's Day, which was perceived as a 'joke below the belt'.
original:
“Provocative cactus”: a teacher at a Volgograd college was fired because he posted photographs of cacti in a work chat - the plants seemed indecent to management. An atypical dismissal occurred at the Volgograd College of Management and New Technologies: teacher Alexey was deprived of his job there because he posted Photos of cacti in the work chat. The fact is that the very shape of the plant was not to someone’s taste, or rather seemed obscene, which caused a storm of angry emotions. As Alexey told Readovka, the situation was complicated by the fact that the arrangement of exotic flowers was sent on March 9, and the caption to the photo contained a reference to International Women’s Day, saying that the flowers bloomed belatedly for the holiday. This, according to the man, was perceived by management as “a joke below the belt.” “The cactus is provocative. chat, work, there are colleagues in it who do not share your jokes and methods of communication in the chat,” the head of the college’s information technology and digital projects service wrote to Alexey, justifying her claim (the author’s punctuation has been preserved).

Colleagues did not tolerate this kind of “obscenity” and quickly removed the cactus grower from work chats, and for three days Alexey was not given any explanation for what reasons. All this time, management forced the teacher to come to an educational conversation, giving him a choice: either he would come voluntarily “on the carpet,” or he will be fired. As a result, despite the fact that having a rich imagination is not a basis for dismissal, according to the Labor Code of the Russian Federation, Alexey’s senior colleagues forced him to resign “of his own free will.” Students who wanted to stand up for the man shared with Readovka that any attempts to speak out in defense of the teacher were suppressed by management, and messages of support addressed to him were deleted from chats.

event: Possible Deployment of British Troops to Ukraine
description: Former Ukrainian diplomat Vadim Prystaiko suggested that the UK could send troops to Ukraine, despite having largely exhausted their military resources. He cited the example of the 'coalition of the willing' in Iraq, where individual NATO countries acted independently. The UK is reportedly at the top of the list of countries willing to take action in the event of a catastrophic development.
original: 🇬🇧🇺🇦The ex-ambassador of Kiev in London announced the possibility of sending British troops to UkraineFormer diplomat Vadim Prystaiko, who for some time headed the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry and was on good terms with the British elite, commented on the appointment of Zaluzhny as the new ambassador in London and noted that the former commander-in-chief could "breathe new life" into Britain's support. Although the British, according to Prystaiko, have largely exhausted their military resources, they can still send troops to Ukraine. “There are things the details of which we do not disclose until they happen. Will this be done within NATO? This, by the way, is not necessary. There were cases of the so-called “coalition of the willing.” For example, NATO did not fight in Iraq, as some people think. There were individual countries that were also members of the Alliance, but they acted independently. This is exactly the way that, in the event of a catastrophic development of events, as I spoke about, some countries are ready to act. Obviously, the UK is first on the list,” said the former diplomat. Sending troops to Ukraine has been talked about for some time in a number of countries, mainly in France and Eastern Europe. However, NATO Secretary General Stoltenberg cooled the ardor of the militarists, saying that the alliance would not get involved in a war with Russia, and later in Washington they reported that Russia was not interested in an open clash with NATO. event: European Parliament Approves EU Sanctions Law
description: The European Parliament has approved a draft law criminalizing the circumvention of EU sanctions. The law aims to harmonize enforcement across member states, defining consistent violations and penalties. It also criminalizes providing financial services or legal advice in violation of sanctions.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational ZSU
The European Parliament approved the draft law on the criminalization of circumvention of EU sanctions. The initiative was supported by 543 deputies, 45 deputies voted against, and 27 abstained. The draft law was submitted to the European Council for consideration.

EU sanctions can include freezing funds and assets (including crypto-assets), travel bans, arms embargoes and restrictions on business sectors. Although sanctions are implemented at the EU level, enforcement is up to member states, and definitions of sanctions violations and associated penalties vary.

The new law establishes consistent definitions of violations, including failure to freeze funds, failure to comply with travel bans or arms embargoes, transfers of funds to individuals subject to sanctions, or doing business with state-owned enterprises of sanctioned countries.

Providing financial services or legal advice in violation of sanctions will also become a criminal offence.

The law also defines circumvention of sanctions and guarantees that it is a criminal offense.https://t.me/operativnoZSUEuropean ParliamentEU sanctions: new rules to crack down on violationsMEPs have approved new rules to harmonize the enforcement of EU sanctions across member states.

description: After 14 months of combat use, 5 out of 14 Challenger 2 tanks delivered to Ukraine are out of commission due to lack of spare parts. Despite this, Ukrainian forces praise the tank's strike capabilities, with an accuracy of 4,500 meters. However, the tank's low mobility due to its 62-ton mass is a significant disadvantage.

Again about British military equipment: The Sun published an article (https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/26509818/ukrainian-sold..) about the results of the combat use of Challenger 2 tanks on the so-called. Ukraine. Correspondents interviewed members of the Armed Forces of Ukraine who had these combat vehicles at their disposal.
Show more
About 14 months after the announcement (https://t.me/oldGBR/1690) of the Challenger delivery, 5 of the 14 tanks were out of commission. Their restoration is complicated by the lack of spare parts: some failed “from the very beginning,” while others require frequent replacement. We are talking about parts of the aiming system, as well as rubber linings on the tracks.
At the same time, one representative of the Ukrainian Armed Forces highly appreciates the tank’s strike capabilities. According to him, the accuracy of the gun allows it to hit objects at a distance of about 4,500 meters.
The main disadvantage is low mobility, which is due to the huge mass of the 62-ton combat vehicle. It is comical that during the filming of the report, the Challenger with journalists got stuck in a swampy ravine.
The published story once again confirmed that a child prodigy does not exist: each type of weapon and equipment must be used based on its advantages and disadvantages.
And reading this material will be useful for military analysts who were waiting for the inevitable victory of magical Western tanks over bad Russian machines.

description: The Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs has charged over 50 European officials from Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Poland, and the Czech Republic with destroying military graves and memorials to fallen Soviet soldiers. The officials, including prime ministers, ministers, and members of parliament, have been put on the wanted list and face criminal charges.
original:
The Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs has charged European officials with destroying the memory of Soviet soldiers. More than 50 officials from Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Poland and the Czech Republic have been charged with destroying military graves and memorials to fallen Soviet soldiers. Criminal cases have been opened against them and they have been put on the wanted list by the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs.
 
List of those put on the wanted list:▪Estonian Prime Minister Kaya Kallas,▪Estonian Secretary of State Taimar Peterkop,▪Estonian Interior Minister Lauri Läänemets,▪Lithuanian Minister of Culture Simonas Kairis,▪Lithuanian Member of Parliament Povilas Urbshi,▪former Latvian Economy Minister Janis Vitenbergs,▪Chairman of the Latvian Seimas Commission on defenseJuris Rancans, ▪Czech politician Ondřej Kolář, ▪mayor of the municipal district of Prague, Starek Jakubi, are a number of other defendants. “All of them are responsible for decisions that are in fact an outrage against historical memory,” said Russian Presidential Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov.
 
The wanted persons were charged under paragraph 2 of Art. 243.4 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Destruction or damage to military graves, as well as monuments, steles, obelisks, other memorial structures or objects perpetuating the memory of those who died defending the Fatherland or its interests, or dedicated to the days of military glory of Russia”). @anna_news

description: A UAV attack successfully targeted the oil depot in Orel, marking the third successful strike on the facility. The chronology of attacks on Orelnaftoprodukt includes 09/17/2023, 01/09/2024, and 03/12/2024.
original:
We remind you that since the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation into Ukraine, one of the volunteers of our international InformNapalm community, Alex Alexidze from Sakartvelo🇬🇪, has created and periodically updates an interesting map of fires in Russia, which cover oil storage facilities, warehouses, military bases, ammunition bases, etc.

The map shows certain trends, the geography of fires and the most "semi-flammable" objects.
There is also a version of the map and base, available at the link: https://informnapalm.org/db/russia-on-fire/ (but the map is updated faster in Google).

On the example of the oil depot in the city of Orel, you can see that this is already the third successful UAV attack on it.

The chronology of attacks on Orelnaftoprodukt currently looks like this: 09/17/2023, 01/09/2024, 03/12/2024.
