description: FACA military doctors conducted an educational campaign in Pissa, Central African Republic, to raise awareness about STIs, tuberculosis, and gender-based violence. The campaign aimed to reduce disease spread and prevent sexual violence. It included free HIV testing and consultation, and informed residents about the Unit for Response and Repression of Sexual Violence against Women and Children (UMIRR).
original:
🛡The protection of the population by the Central African Armed Forces (FACA) is not limited to only weapons. FACA military doctors conduct educational work among the population in the city of Pissa about STIs, tuberculosis and gender-based violence. The purpose of this event is to reduce the spread of diseases and prevent cases of sexual violence.

Captain Deborah Yaramanji, Gender and HIV Coordinator at the Ministry of National Defence, said the awareness campaign was carried out in Pissa, Bobangi, Berengo, Bangui Bushia and is accompanied by voluntary and free HIV testing after consultation.

Residents are also explained that a special Unit for Response and Repression of Sexual Violence against Women and Children (UMIRR) has been created, whose task is to take action against sexual violence and violations of the rights of children, so victims should not be afraid to report these types of violence.#security#health

event: Prosecutor's Office Forces Tenant to Restore Land
description: The Nemyshlyan District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv successfully sued an LLC to restore a land plot worth over UAH 47 million to its original condition. The LLC had leased the land for reconstruction and construction of a rehabilitation complex but used a much larger area than necessary, littering part of the plot with construction waste.
original:
🔷We oppose the pollution of land resources: the prosecutor's office obliged the unscrupulous tenant to bring the land worth more than UAH 47 million into usable condition🖌️The court satisfied the claim of the Nemyshlyan District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv in the interests of the state, represented by the Kharkiv City Council, to the LLC to restore the situation that existed before the violation, namely bringing the land plot worth more than UAH 47 million into a condition suitable for use.

It was established that the LLC registered ownership of a non-residential building located on the street. Louis Pasteur in Kharkiv. The area of the building is almost 2 thousand square meters. meters

In 2021, based on the decision of the Kharkiv City Council, a land plot with an area of almost 6.5 hectares was leased to the specified LLC at the expense of residential and public development land for the reconstruction of the specified non-residential building with the construction of a rehabilitation and preventive complex.

The district prosecutor's office appealed to the court with a claim to invalidate this lease agreement and the obligation to return the specified land to the Kharkiv City Territorial Community.

The prosecutors noted that the permission to develop land management documentation for the construction, operation and maintenance of facilities does not contain a clear indication of which part of the allocated land was intended and necessary for the reconstruction of the real estate facility and the construction of the specified complex. Thus, the LLC used a plot of land with an area 47.9 times greater than the area of the building itself.

The Economic Court of the Kharkiv region supported the position of the prosecutor's office and satisfied the lawsuit, obliging the LLC to return the land plot.

However, during the inspection of this land plot with the involvement of specialists of the Department of State Environmental Supervision (Control) of Waste and Hazardous Chemical Substances and Industrial Pollution, it was found that part of the plot was littered with construction waste.👉🏻Read in full⚔️Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

event: Ukrainian Drone Strike on Oil Depot
description: A Ukrainian drone struck an oil depot in the Oryol region, causing a fire that engulfed one tank containing petroleum products. Emergency services and special services are working to contain the fire, with no reported casualties.
original:
BRIEFPhoto, An oil depot is on fire in the Oryol region, Baza reports. According to preliminary data, the fire started due to at... One tank with petroleum products caught fire at an oil depot in Oryol, preliminary, after a Ukrainian drone strike, a representative of the emergency services of the Oryol region told RIA Novosti.
The information was confirmed by the governor of the Oryol region Andrey Klychkov. “A UAV crashed in Orel. A fuel and energy complex facility was attacked. Special services are working on the spot to contain the fire. There were no casualties,” he noted.

description: Russian security forces conducted searches at the addresses of actionist artists across the country, including St. Petersburg, Moscow, Ulyanovsk, Nizhny Novgorod, Ekaterinburg, and Samara. The searches were related to the criminal case of Pyotr Verzilov, a co-founder of the Voina art group. Several artists were detained and taken for interrogation, with some having their equipment confiscated.
original:
‼️Across Russia security forces came to search actionist artists. It is known about searches at the addresses of actionist artists: Katrin Nenasheva and Natalia Chetverio (St. Petersburg) art group “Yav” (St. Petersburg) Sasha Blota (Petersburg) Kristina Bubentsova (Petersburg) Rita Flores [Margarita Konovalova] (Moscow)
friend of the artist Philippenzo (Moscow) Olga Kuracheva, member of Pussy Riot (Moscow) Olga Pakhtusova, member of Pussy Riot (Moscow) Egor Holtov (Ulyanovsk) Artem Filatova and Andrey Olenev (Nizhny Novgorod) Ilya Mozgi (Ekaterinburg) Denis Mustafin (Samara)

They also came to the apartment of Pyotr Verzilov*’s mother.

The security forces who arrived introduce themselves as the FSB, and they have the means of opening apartments with them.

The questions are related to the criminal case of Pyotr Verzilov*, Yavi activists said. Those familiar with the circumstances of the arrest and search of Nenasheva also said that the searches were related to Verzilov’s criminal case.

Nenasheva was taken to the department, communications equipment, gadgets and computer equipment were confiscated from the house.

The search at Kholtov’s place took place around 8 am, reports the telegram channel “Simbirsk Shugozhor” with reference to the artist’s mother. He has been detained, a lawyer has not yet been found, and his mother is in tears.

After the searches, Olga Kuracheva and Olga Pakhtusova from Pussy Riot were taken away for interrogation.

The detention of Kristina Bubentsova was reported by the telegram channel of the Party of the Dead.

Artist Ilya Mozgi was taken away for questioning in Yekaterinburg after a search.

Samara: Denis Mustafin was not at his home address - the artist’s mother’s computer was confiscated.📍Verzilov’s case. Actionist and co-founder of the Voina art group Pyotr Verzilov was sentenced in absentia to 8.5 years in the case of “military fakes” for posts on social networks about Bucha, but on March 11 the Moscow City Court overturned the verdict and sent the case for a new trial. Verzilov, as he himself claims, has participated in battles on the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces since 2023. He left Russia before February 2022. *The Ministry of Justice included him in the register of foreign agents.
